page.title: 18Local History
page.content: A gentleman who has lived for 73 years in the village of Hemingbrough has described some of his memories to a group of 11_year_olds. I have lived in 6 different houses one of which was an old Public House called The Half Moon which stood opposite St Mary's church and no longer exists. When the new road, A63, was cut through Northfield in 1929 I bought a piece of new land and built a new house at the corner where the petrol station now stands. Over the years I have owned various pieces of land and farmed in the village. I employed labourers and seasonal workers and had working horses before the age of machinery. In 1916 I was the first person in Hemingbrough to own a motor car,a Briton.
